title: Richard Stoltzman - Begin Sweet World [FLAC]
description:
(Corrected torrent - previous version was missing hi res scans of folder and media)

As much "Easy Listening" as it is "Jazz," this CD's title cut is as beautiful a piece of music as has ever been written.


Artists:		Richard Stoltzman - Clarinet
			Bill Douglas - Piano, Electric Piano, Bassoon
			Jeremy Wall - Synthesizers
			Eddie Gomez - Bass

Recording Location:	Bear Tracks Studio, Suffern, NY
Recording Date:		July, 1985
Producer:		Jeremy Wall
Recording Engineer:	Larry Swist
Asst. Engineer:		John Penzotti

Label:			RCA Red Seal/Skylark Series
			RCD1-7124
Release Date:		November 2, 1991

AllMusic Review (Unknown Reviewer):
The flawlessly assembled program, released in 1986, includes six original ballads written by longtime collaborator Bill Douglas; classical selections by Bach, Faure, and Debussy; jazz-tinged pieces from Thelonius Monk and producer/synthesist Jeremy Wall; and Stoltzman's signature rendition of "Amazing Grace." Douglas's refined touch on piano, electric piano and bassoon, and Eddie Gomez's soulful string bass round out a sonically and musically superior album that has something for just about everyone. Begin Sweet World is one of the all-time great music gifts.
